moves.name: Stand LP
moves.notes: Chains into stand LP / crouch LP / crouch LK

extraInfo: Chains into stand LP / crouch LP / crouch LK
Shorter range than crouch LP but +1F extra hitstun meaning move combo potential (naturally combos into things like LP/MP Ryuuenbu (QCB special)
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Stand MP
moves.notes: Decent range with strong hitbox priority and fully cancelable makes this a solid neutral tool

extraInfo: Decent range with strong hitbox priority and fully cancelable makes this a solid neutral tool

moves.name: Stand HP
moves.notes: Core combo and whiff punish tool that leads into Mai's highest damage routes

extraInfo: Core combo and whiff punish tool that leads into Mai's highest damage routes

moves.name: Stand LK
moves.notes: Very short range but goes into the LK Target Combo follow-ups

extraInfo: Very short range but goes into the LK Target Combo follow-ups
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo
BUG?: Has 1F extra hitstop compared to the universal rule of light attacks

moves.name: Stand MK
moves.notes: Good combo / poke / whiff punish tool

extraInfo: Good combo / poke / whiff punish tool
Mai lifts up her front leg hurtbox on frames 4-17 making this a good tool against low attacks
Good hitbox priority
Can easily be hit confirmed into SA2 on Punish Counter (also works on Counter-Hit at closer ranges)

moves.name: Stand HK
moves.notes: Good whiff punish tool

extraInfo: Good whiff punish tool
Causes a crumple-like free juggle state on a grounded Punish Counter (opponent is airborne for any follow-up hits)
Mai lifts up her standing leg hurtbox on frames 10-16 making this a decent tool against low attacks
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state on Punish Counter
The brief extended leg hurtbox on frame 13 of start-up (1F before active) is strike invincible (cannot counter-poke projectiles)
+3F extra recovery frames (22F) on whiff

moves.name: Crouch LP
moves.notes: Chains into stand LP / crouch LP / crouch LK

extraInfo: Chains into stand LP / crouch LP / crouch LK
Furthest range of Mai's light buttons (but less combo potential than 5LP due to 1F less hitstun)
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo
Topmost hurtboxes on frames 1-6 are vulnerable only to airborne attacks (this is to discourage its use as an anti-air)

moves.name: Crouch MP
moves.notes: Decent combo / buffer tool

extraInfo: Decent combo / buffer tool
Solid range for a crouch MP
+2F extra recovery frames (17F) on whiff

moves.name: Crouch HP
moves.notes: Mostly a combo tool (like from Drive Rush) but the first hit does have very strong hitbox priority for counter-poking

extraInfo: Mostly a combo tool (like from Drive Rush) but the first hit does have very strong hitbox priority for counter-poking
First hit pulls in the opponent on hit or block

moves.name: Crouch LK
moves.notes: Chains into stand LP / crouch LP / crouch LK

extraInfo: Chains into stand LP / crouch LP / crouch LK
Incurs 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Crouch MK
moves.notes: Your average SF6 crouch MK

extraInfo: Your average SF6 crouch MK
Incurs a 20% damage scaling penalty if used as the first hit of a combo

moves.name: Crouch HK
moves.notes: Has good hitbox priority against low attacks (the extended kick hurtbox can effectively low crush some low attacks)

extraInfo: Has good hitbox priority against low attacks (the extended kick hurtbox can effectively low crush some low attacks)
+1F extra recovery frames (23F) on block
+3F extra recovery frames (25F) on whiff

moves.name: Jump LP
moves.notes: Fast air-to-air option

extraInfo: Fast air-to-air option
Best horizontal hitbox priority of Mai's jumping attacks

moves.name: Jump MP
moves.notes: Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state

extraInfo: Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Good air-to-air hitboxes

moves.name: Jump HP
moves.notes: Good hitbox for vertical air approaches

extraInfo: Good hitbox for vertical air approaches

moves.name: Jump LK
moves.notes: Cross-up

extraInfo: Cross-up
Can be used as an instant Overhead

moves.name: Jump MK
moves.notes: Cross-up

extraInfo: Cross-up

moves.name: Jump HK
moves.notes: Furthest horizontal range of Mai's jump-in attacks

extraInfo: Furthest horizontal range of Mai's jump-in attacks

moves.name: Senkotsu Uchi
moves.notes: Fast Overhead with decent frame advantage (can meaty on last active frame to get jab combo follow-ups)

extraInfo: Fast Overhead with decent frame advantage (can meaty on last active frame to get jab combo follow-ups)
Causes a spiked knockdown on airborne opponents

moves.name: Handstand Kick
moves.notes: Legs and lower body (keep in mind Mai is upside down) are invincible to airborne strikes on frames 8-12 making this a fantastic anti-air

extraInfo: Legs and lower body (keep in mind Mai is upside down) are invincible to airborne strikes on frames 8-12 making this a fantastic anti-air
Forced stand on hit (important for some combo routes)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Mai)
Very easily hit confirmable into its Target Combo follow-up
Decent oki tool with lots of active frames that can be up to +7 on hit / +3 on block

moves.name: Hien Ren Kyaku 1
moves.notes: Forces stand on hit

extraInfo: Forces stand on hit
This 2-hit version can be useful for some combo extensions while the latter hits of Kachousen (fan) are falling down onto the opponent

moves.name: Hien Ren Kyaku 2
moves.notes: Mai leaps off the opponent and can be followed up with a Musasabi no Mai (Divekick) or SA2 before landing (Divekick can be delayed quite a bit for potentially better angle and + frames on Flame Stock version)

extraInfo: Mai leaps off the opponent and can be followed up with a Musasabi no Mai (Divekick) or SA2 before landing (Divekick can be delayed quite a bit for potentially better angle and + frames on Flame Stock version)
Airborne on frames 10-35 (Forced Knockdown state) followed by 4F landing recovery
True blockstring and mostly safe on block midscreen due to the distance it creates
Some Supers reach far enough to punish Mai, but in many cases she can respond with Divekick or Air Level 2 Super on reaction to avoid the punish
Divekick follow-up won't combo if the Divekick is delayed too much (59F hit confirm window for the Divekick to still combo)
Divekick follow-up leads into +42 safe jump oki if the initial LK hits slightly spaced out

moves.name: Hoshi Kujaku
moves.notes: Extremely easy to hit confirm (28F window)

extraInfo: Extremely easy to hit confirm (28F window)
Puts opponents into a limited juggle state (juggle follow-ups depend on if the opponent was grounded or airborne like after a Drive Rush juggle extension)
Mai becomes fully invincible after the HK follow-up lands on hit
+8 extra recovery frames on whiff

moves.name: Shiranui Gourin
moves.notes: Throw Loop: Dash up for +3 mixup between strike / throw (corner only)

extraInfo: Throw Loop: Dash up for +3 mixup between strike / throw (corner only)
Throw loop leaves Mai at the perfect spacing to walk backwards to bait the opponent's throw tech (except vs. Blanka, E. Honda, Marisa, and Zangief)
Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter

moves.name: Fuusha Kuzushi
moves.notes: Back Throw oki: Can do meaty attacks or Drive Rush into strike / throw (corner only)

extraInfo: Back Throw oki: Can do meaty attacks or Drive Rush into strike / throw (corner only)
Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter

moves.name: Yume Zakura
moves.notes: Corner Air Throw: Dash up for +2 mixup between strike / throw (corner only)

extraInfo: Corner Air Throw: Dash up for +2 mixup between strike / throw (corner only)
Gets +70% damage increase (2040 damage), HKD (denies back-roll option on wake-up), and depletes 1 bar of Drive Gauge on a Punish Counter

moves.name: Drive Impact: Botan Ichige
moves.notes: 2 hits of armor on frames 1-27

extraInfo: 2 hits of armor on frames 1-27
Damages opponents Drive Gauge on Block (1/2 bar) | Hit (1 bar) | Counter-Hit (1.25 bar) | Punish Counter (1.5 bar)
Knocks down on hit

Crumples on Punish Counter or after absorbing at least 1 attack during start-up (+21 frames before the crumple state goes airborne, followed by airborne state on frames 22-46 before they are grounded) which counts as 2 hits of damage scaling
If the armor absorbs an attack it slows the overall start-up by 1F (27F total instead of 26F)
Pushes the opponent far back on hit or block and causes a wall splat if they hit the wall
Wall Splat on block adds 20% damage penalty on the next hit
Wall splats on hit or during Burnout counts as 2 hits of damage scaling
Wall Splat puts opponent into a special juggle state where the next move juggles them even if it doesn't normally (similar juggle rules as from Drive Rush)
Does not cause wall splat if combo'd into from other moves or unblockable setups (Lock)
Puts airborne opponents into a long spinning free juggle state when hit as a Punish Counter
Regular KDA without a Wall Splat: +35 KD
Corner wall splat on HIT: +65 KD | Block: +72 HKD
KDA can vary greatly depending on how high the opponent wall splats (higher KDA the higher they wall splat)
Can clash with other Drive Impacts if they collide on the same active frame (start at exactly the same time)
Costs 1 bar of Drive Gauge
The scrub killer

moves.name: Drive Reversal: Yusura Ume
moves.notes: Fully invincible on frames 1-22 (frames 1-20 when used on wake-up as a Reversal)

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-22 (frames 1-20 when used on wake-up as a Reversal)
Armor Break (blows through all armor like Drive Impact)
Can be performed during blockstun or from a successful parry (trying to Drive Reversal after the blockstun is over will result in a Drive Impact)
Can also be performed during wake-up as a Reversal, doing it this way speeds up the start-up frames by 2 frames (18F start-up instead of 20F)
Drive Reversal immediately removes the current blockstun you're in and starts the attack
Causes a 4F screen freeze that occurs after the 6th start-up frame, which can mess up the opponents input timing, or enable them to do a simple input OS to counter the Drive Reversal
Safe on block (-2) when used against an opponent currently in Burnout
Costs 2 bars of Drive Gauge

moves.name: Drive Parry
moves.notes: Parries all strikes and projectiles (high and low) from frame 1

extraInfo: Parries all strikes and projectiles (high and low) from frame 1
12F parry window (can hold the parry to extend the parry window)
Perfect Parry occurs on the first 2 active frames (cannot achieve Perfect Parry if you buffer into parry by holding it during Reversal windows; Perfect Parries have to be timed properly)
Can still hold charge directions during Parry
Can block during the recovery frames of a regular parry (can still get hit during the recovery frames if you don't block correctly)
Getting thrown or hit at any point during the recovery frames of a whiffed parry attempt results in a Punish Counter
Successfully parrying a move puts you into the same amount of blockstun as that move would regularly do on block (but a Perfect Parry has only 1F of recovery)
Throw invincible during the recovery of a successful parry (just like during blockstun)
Perfect Parrying a strike has only 1F of recovery and disables the opponent from canceling their attack (basically a guaranteed punish opportunity)

After a successful Perfect Parry, you suffer a 50% penalty to your Damage, Drive Gauge Generation, and Drive Gauge Damage on any of your following attacks when punishing the opponent (in addition, both you and the opponent suffer a 20% penalty to their Super Meter gain during this period)
Fully invincible for 6F after a successful Perfect Parry against a strike, during which period you can cancel into anything you want and it carries over the brief invincibility frames
Perfect Parrying projectiles puts you into fixed 10 frames of recovery and applies the same 50% scaling penalties (and 20% Super Meter penalty) on your following attacks when punishing the opponent
Parrying a Strike and Projectile on the same frame will result in a regular parry for the strike attack (effectively ignoring the projectile's hitstop / blockstun)
Perfect Parrying a Strike and Projectile on the same frame will give a screen freeze like you Perfect Parried a Strike, but still give you 10F recovery as if you had Perfect Parried a Projectile
Can cancel into Drive Rush during active frames 3 and onward (fastest Drive Rush method is to buffer a forward input before doing parry + forward again)
Can cancel into Drive Reversal from a successful parry (just like you can normally during blockstun)
Costs 1/2 bar Drive Gauge (continues to deplete Drive Gauge as you hold the Parry)
You lose the parry if you go into Burnout from the Drive Gauge cost
Rewards 1 bar Drive Gauge (1/2 bar total after factoring in the initial parry cost) for successfully parrying a strike
Rewards 1/2 bar of Drive Gauge (0 bar total after factoring in the initial parry cost) for successfully parrying a projectile
Rewards 2 bars of Drive Gauge (1.5 bars total after factoring in the initial parry cost) for successful parrying a Drive Impact
Successfully parrying a strike attack splits the regular block pushback between both players (while Perfect Parrying a strike removes all of its pushback)
Successfully parrying a projectile or Drive Impact reduces the pushback of it by half (while Perfect Parrying a projectile or Drive Impact removes all of its pushback)

Your hurtbox and throw box expand slightly towards the opponent for the entire duration of the Parry (Throw box extension starts instantly on frame 1, while the Hurtbox extension starts on frame 3, after the initial 2F Perfect Parry window)
Parrying while crouching maintains a regular crouch hurtbox for the first 2 frames of the parry (during the initial Perfect Parry window)

moves.name: Drive Rush
moves.notes: Dashes forward and enhances the next normal used out of the Drive Rush with +4 extra hitstun / blockstun (some moves also get unique properties enhanced such as juggle state)

extraInfo: Dashes forward and enhances the next normal used out of the Drive Rush with +4 extra hitstun / blockstun (some moves also get unique properties enhanced such as juggle state)
The +4 bonus frame advantage gained from a Drive Rush enhanced move also stacks with any bonus frame advantage that move may have gained from Counter-Hit or Punish Counter
Cancelable into from special cancelable grounded normals

Drive Rush maintains buffers (freezes the buffer window) during it start-up and freeze frames - This allows players to do things normally not possible within the normal buffer windows, such as Drive Rushing into a charge special
The initial freeze frames that occur when a Drive Rush happens eats the opponents inputs
Framedata shown in parentheses refers to the Drive Rush version used from a Parry

Drive Rush recovery frames is only 24F total (23F if done from a Parry) - but the enhanced dash itself is 46F total (45F if done from Parry) and you can cancel it as early as frame 9 (frame 11 if done from a Parry)

You stop building any form of Drive Gauge on your attacks after using a Drive Rush in the MIDDLE of a combo (but you still continue to build drive gauge as normal if you did Drive Rush at the START of a combo)
Applies extra damage scaling penalty after using a Drive Rush in the MIDDLE of a combo (no damage scaling if you use Drive Rush at the START of a combo)
Costs 3 bars of Drive Gauge if canceled into from a move
Costs 1/2 bar of Drive Gauge if canceled into from Parry (for a total of 1 bar of Drive Gauge when you factor in the initial 1/2 bar cost of the Parry)

moves.name: Taunt
moves.notes: Back Taunt is 430F start-up that spawns 8-hit Super projectile hitboxes on both sides of Mai

extraInfo: Back Taunt is 430F start-up that spawns 8-hit Super projectile hitboxes on both sides of Mai
Projectile hitbox low to the ground that hits for 800 damage total (1500 damage if doing the held version) but is also hugely punishable even on hit
Deals no chip damage

moves.name: LP Kachousen
moves.notes: 1-hit projectile

extraInfo: 1-hit projectile
Projectile Speed: 0.04
The fan has its own hurtbox and can be swatted away by the opponent's strike or projectiles (top half of its hurtbox is invincible to airborne strikes)
Holding the button for 19 frames lets Mai throw a larger and more powerful version (see the hold version for details)
Leg (3~48F) and arm (16~42F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state

moves.name: LP Kachousen (stock)
moves.notes: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage total) and cannot be swatted away by the opponents attacks (functions like a regular projectile)

extraInfo: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage total) and cannot be swatted away by the opponents attacks (functions like a regular projectile)
2-hit projectile
Projectile Speed: 0.04
Holding the button for 19 frames lets Mai throw a larger and more powerful version (see the stock + hold version for details)
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage to both hits
Leg (3~45F) and arm (16~42F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Only cancelable into SA3 on the first hit

moves.notes: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage total) and cannot be swatted away by the opponents attacks (functions like a regular projectile)

moves.name: HP Kachousen
moves.notes: 1-hit projectile

extraInfo: 1-hit projectile
Projectile Speed: 0.07
The fan has its own hurtbox and can be swatted away by the opponent's strike or projectiles (top half of its hurtbox is invincible to airborne strikes)
Holding the button for 19 frames lets Mai throw a larger and more powerful version (see the hold version for details)
Leg (3~48F) and arm (12~38F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state

moves.name: HP Kachousen (stock)
moves.notes: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage total) and cannot be swatted away by the opponents attacks (functions like a regular projectile)

extraInfo: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage total) and cannot be swatted away by the opponents attacks (functions like a regular projectile)
2-hit projectile
Projectile Speed: 0.07
Holding the button for 19 frames lets Mai throw a larger and more powerful version (see the stock + hold version for details)
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage to both hits
Leg (3~45F) and arm (12~38F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Only cancelable into SA3 on the first hit

moves.name: Kachousen (hold)
moves.notes: 1-hit projectile

extraInfo: 1-hit projectile
This fan cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like a normal projectile would)
The fan bounces upwards before falling back down (Projectile hitbox) after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (this gives Mai time to get in some follow-up hits or pressure)
Projectile Speed and how far up the fan bounces upon hit / block varies depending on button strength
LP (Classic) / L (Modern): 0.04 speed and low fan bounce
MP (Classic) / M (Modern): 0.05 speed and medium fan bounce
HP (Classic) / H (Modern): 0.07 speed and high fan bounce
LP fan bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 1F on hit / 3F on block | vs Crouch: 7F on hit / 9F on block
MP fan bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 18F on hit / 20F on block | vs Crouch: 24F on hit / 26F on block
HP fan bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 30F on hit / 32F on block | vs Crouch: 36F on hit / 38F on block

The frame gaps in fan bounces are slightly smaller on taller characters (1F smaller vs DJ | 2F smaller vs Zangief, Marisa and JP, meaning that a fully held LP fan bounce combos naturally on hit against those 3 characters when they're standing)
Leg (3-62F), body (19-31F), and arm (32-48F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Frame advantage listed on hit / block refers to the initial hit before the bounce (the bouncing fan deals 30F hitstun / 26F blockstun by itself, granting Mai potentially huge frame advantage)
Any follow-up attack that Mai does overwrites the hitstun / blockstun of the bouncing fan

moves.name: Kachousen (stock + hold)
moves.notes: Enhanced: 1 extra hit and +100 damage (600 damage) before the bounce

extraInfo: Enhanced: 1 extra hit and +100 damage (600 damage) before the bounce
2-hit projectile
This fan cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like a normal projectile would)
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage to the first 2 hits before the bounce
The fan bounces upwards before falling back down (Projectile hitbox) after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (this gives Mai time to get in some follow-up hits or pressure)
Projectile Speed and how far up the fan bounces upon hit / block varies depending on button strength
LP (Classic) / L (Modern): 0.04 speed and low fan bounce
MP (Classic) / M (Modern): 0.05 speed and medium fan bounce
HP (Classic) / H (Modern): 0.07 speed and high fan bounce
LP fan bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 9F on hit / 11F on block | vs Crouch: 15F on hit / 17F on block
MP fan bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 26F on hit / 28F on block | vs Crouch: 32F on hit / 34F on block
HP fan bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 38F on hit / 40F on block | vs Crouch: 44F on hit / 46F on block
The frame gaps in fan bounces are slightly smaller on taller characters (1F smaller vs DJ | 2F smaller vs Zangief, Marisa and JP)
Leg (32-62F) and arm (32-48F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
The bouncing fan does not trigger proximity guard (opponent can walk back during it) and counts as an air attack (anti-air invulnerable moves can pass through it)

moves.name: OD Kachousen
moves.notes: 1-hit OD projectile

extraInfo: 1-hit OD projectile
Projectile Speed: 0.05
This fan cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like a normal OD projectile would)
Bounces upwards before falling back down after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (this gives Mai time to get in some follow-up hits or pressure)
Bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 15F on hit / 21F on block | vs Crouch: 21F on hit / 27F on block
The frame gaps in fan bounces are slightly smaller on taller characters (1F smaller vs DJ | 2F smaller vs Zangief, Marisa and JP)
Holding the button for 19 frames lets Mai throw extra fans (see the hold version and subsequent follow-up move for details)
Leg hurtbox (12-37F) and upper body (15-27F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Only the initial hit is cancelable into SA2/SA3
The bouncing fan does not trigger proximity guard (opponent can walk back during it) and counts as an air attack (anti-air invulnerable moves can pass through it)

moves.name: OD Kachousen (stock)
moves.notes: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage) before the bounce, and grants +1 frame advantage on block (regular OD version is -3 on block)

extraInfo: Enhanced: 1 extra hit, +100 damage (600 damage) before the bounce, and grants +1 frame advantage on block (regular OD version is -3 on block)
2-hit OD projectile
Projectile Speed: 0.05
This fan cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like a normal OD projectile would)
Bounces upwards before falling back down after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (this gives Mai time to get in some follow-up hits or pressure)
Bounce gaps on hit / block vs Standing: 23F on hit / 25F on block | vs Crouch: 29F on hit / 31F on block
The frame gaps in fan bounces are slightly smaller on taller characters (1F smaller vs DJ | 2F smaller vs Zangief, Marisa and JP)
Holding the button for 19 frames lets Mai throw extra fans (see the stock + hold version and subsequent follow-up Midare Kachousen (stock) move for details))
Leg hurtbox (12-37F) and upper body (15-27F) hurtbox extensions are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state
Only the initial hit is cancelable into SA2/SA3
The bouncing fan does not trigger proximity guard (opponent can walk back during it) and counts as an air attack (anti-air invulnerable moves can pass through it)

moves.name: OD Kachousen (hold)
moves.notes: Two separate 1-hit OD projectiles

extraInfo: Two separate 1-hit OD projectiles
Projectile Speed: 0.05
Carries over Counter-Hit / Punish Counter bonus frame advantage to both hits
These fans cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like normal OD projectiles would)
Can be followed-up with an extension (f+P) where Mai throws another two fans for no extra cost of resources (see the follow-up Midare Kachousen move for details)
Arm/head hurtbox extensions on frames 28-58 are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state (but does not increase the current juggle state)
Only the first hit is cancelable into SA2/SA3

moves.name: OD Kachousen (stock + hold)
moves.notes: Enhanced: Both fans bounce upwards after connecting on hit / block and they all naturally combo for +100 extra damage (700 damage total)

extraInfo: Enhanced: Both fans bounce upwards after connecting on hit / block and they all naturally combo for +100 extra damage (700 damage total)
Two separate 1-hit OD projectiles
Projectile Speed: 0.05
These fans cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like normal OD projectiles would)
Can be followed-up with an extension (f+P) where Mai throws another two fans for no extra cost of resources (see the follow-up Midare Kachousen move for details)
Bounces upwards before falling back down after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (naturally combos and are all a true blockstring)
Frame advantage varies depending on if the opponent is Standing / Crouching - vs Standing: +45 on hit / +46 on block | vs Crouching: +52 on hit / +53 on block
The frame advantage is slightly less on taller characters (DJ, JP, Marisa, Zangief)
Arm/head hurtbox extensions on frames 28-58 are projectile invincible
Puts airborne opponents into a limited juggle state (but does not increase the current juggle state)
Only the first hit is cancelable into SA2/SA3
The bouncing fans do not trigger proximity guard (opponent can walk back during it) and counts as an air attack (anti-air invulnerable moves can pass through them)

moves.name: Midare Kachousen
moves.notes: Two separate 1-hit OD projectiles (Four separate OD projectiles in total if you factor in the prior OD Kachousen)

extraInfo: Two separate 1-hit OD projectiles (Four separate OD projectiles in total if you factor in the prior OD Kachousen)
Projectile Speed: 0.072
These fans cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like normal OD projectiles would)
Bounces upwards before falling back down after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (this gives Mai time to get in some follow-up hits or pressure)

There are brief gaps on block before the follow-up fans connect (close range only), as well as before both the bouncing fans connect (the window of these gaps varies greatly depending on if the opponent is standing / crouching, as well as being few frames smaller for taller characters like DJ, JP, Marisa, Zangief)
Arm/head hurtbox extensions on frames 28-79 are projectile invincible
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit

moves.name: Midare Kachousen (stock)
moves.notes: Enhanced: Deals +200 extra damage on a regular hit (1400 damage total) with both the initial OD fans as well as the follow-up fans all bounce, resulting in 8 projectiles total (4 hitting directly, and 4 bouncing) which gives Mai huge frame advantage on block

extraInfo: Enhanced: Deals +200 extra damage on a regular hit (1400 damage total) with both the initial OD fans as well as the follow-up fans all bounce, resulting in 8 projectiles total (4 hitting directly, and 4 bouncing) which gives Mai huge frame advantage on block
Two separate 1-hit OD projectiles (Four separate OD projectiles in total if you factor in the prior OD Kachousen)
Projectile Speed: 0.072
These fans cannot be swatted away by the opponent (behaves like normal OD projectiles would)
Bounces upwards before falling back down after connecting with the opponent on hit or block (this gives Mai time to get in some follow-up hits or pressure)
The frame advantage on block as well as the bouncing gap on block is far lower on taller characters (DJ, JP, Marisa, Zangief)
Bounce gap on block for the final fan vs normal size characters Standing / Crouching: 9F vs Standing / 7F vs Crouching
Bounce gap on block for the final fan vs taller characters Standing / Crouching: 26F vs Standing / 7F vs Crouching
Frame advantage on block vs normal size characters Standing / Crouching: +33 on block vs Standing / +40 on block vs Crouching
Frame advantage on block vs taller characters Standing / Crouching: +15 on block vs Standing / +39 on block vs Crouching
Arm/head hurtbox extensions on frames 28-79 are projectile invincible
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state on hit

moves.name: LK Hishou Ryuuenjin
moves.notes: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-14

extraInfo: Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 1-14
Airborne on frames 7-37 (Forced Knockdown state)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Mai)
Puts opponent into a limited juggle state on hit
400 less damage (500 total) if only second hit connects on later active frames
Second hit whiffs on most crouch block (except tall bodies like Zangief, Marisa, JP, and DJ) resulting in slightly worse frame advantage (-32) and bit less chip and drive gauge damage

moves.name: LP Ryuuenbu
moves.notes: Strike hitbox that also can also nullify 1 hit of a non-OD projectile

extraInfo: Strike hitbox that also can also nullify 1 hit of a non-OD projectile
This LP version doesn't knockdown on normal hit like the other versions, instead gives good frame advantage on hit (+3) to maintain pressure
KD +35 on Counter-Hit or Punish Counter
Can be spaced out to be relatively safe on block
Decent oki tool due to lots of active frames (up to +9 on hit / +2 on block)

moves.name: LK Hissatsu Shinobi Bachi
moves.notes: Core combo tool with fantastic corner carry

extraInfo: Core combo tool with fantastic corner carry
Puts the opponent into a limited juggle state (sets up for juggle follow-ups in various airborne juggle scenarios)
Reaches about 80% screen length (can be very plus on block if spaced properly or used as meaty oki tool)

Second hit (elbow) whiffs on crouching opponents on active frames 7-13 but hits them again on active frames 14-17 (this means Mai can be interrupted by some crouching attacks but it's also easier to space for + frames against crouching opponents)
Only second hit is cancelable into SA3

moves.name: Kagerou no Mai
moves.notes: Strike and Throw invincible on frames 1-8

extraInfo: Strike and Throw invincible on frames 1-8
Invincible to airborne strikes on frames 9-39
Armor Break
Depletes 0.5 Drive Bar on hit for the opponent
Grants Mai 5 Flame Stocks on the final recovery frame which enhances all her Specials as well as SA1 and SA2
Core tool in Mai's gameplay to get her Flame Stocks
Very fast start-up for a Level 1 Super, although short range
Fantastic anti-air tool that hits on both sides of Mai
Strike hitbox that also has 8 hits of Super projectile durability
Knockdown Advantage listed refers to when used on grounded opponents (KDA is higher and varies greatly on airborne opponents)

moves.name: Chou Hissatsu Shinobi Bachi
moves.notes: Fully invincible on frames 1-8

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-8
Armor Break
Depletes 1 Drive Bar on hit for the opponent
Very good range but lacks the Projectile invincibility to more easily counter projectiles, which the enhanced stock version has
Can counter projectile on reaction if close enough (can punish projectiles from much further away if you do the faster air version (Tiger Knee the QCF input))
Deals less damage at further ranges due the first few hits hitting earlier
+11F extra recovery frames (37F) on block

moves.name: Chou Hissatsu Shinobi Bachi (stock)
moves.notes: Enhanced: Gains Projectile invincibility extension and +200 damage (3000 total), making this a very strong tool against other projectile users

extraInfo: Enhanced: Gains Projectile invincibility extension and +200 damage (3000 total), making this a very strong tool against other projectile users
Fully invincible on frames 1-8 and then Projectile invincible on frames 9-12
Armor Break
Depletes 1 Drive Bar on hit for the opponent
Very good range and can easily counter Projectiles on reaction (airborne version is even better at this)
Deals less damage at further ranges due to first few hits hitting earlier in the active frames
+6F extra recovery frames (37F) on block

moves.name: Air Chou Hissatsu Shinobi Bachi
moves.notes: No form of invincibility whatsoever

extraInfo: No form of invincibility whatsoever
Only 3F start-up when used in air as opposed to the 7F grounded version
Armor Break
Depletes 1 Drive Bar on hit for the opponent (if all hits land)

Very fast and great range makes this a good air-to-air / combo tool, and can also be used to punish long-range fireball attempts (requires good timing since projectiles can clip your hurtbox if you do it too close to the ground)
Deals less damage at further ranges due to the first few hits hitting earlier in the active frames
Frame advantage and damage output varies drastically depending on distance (at least -50 on block, up to -70 or more if blocked and Mai flies over the opponent)
If blocked, Mai is very likely to fly over the opponent if they're not cornered, resulting in Mai being even more punishable on block (but potentially far away)
Cannot hit cross-up (behind Mai)

moves.name: Shiranui Ryuu: Enbu Ada Zakura
moves.notes: Fully invincible on frames 1-11

extraInfo: Fully invincible on frames 1-11
Armor Break
Depletes 1.5 Drive Bars on hit for the opponent
Super cinematic time regenerates ~2 Drive Bars for Mai
Only goes into the cinematic version if it hits on the first hit
Deals less damage if it doesn't go into the cinematic version (2300~3000 damage depending on how it hits) and allows for follow-up DP juggles
3F startup when canceled into from Hissatsu Shinobi Bachi (Cartwheel special)
Incurs 50% damage scaling penalty if the non-cinematic version is used as the first hit of a combo
